cli.intro:
SRA-cli {version} ({core})
Type 'help' or '?' to list commands.
cli.noAdminWarning: You are not running SRA-cli with administrative privileges. Some commands may not work as expected.
cli.unknownCommand: Unknown command: '{command}'. Type 'help' to get a list of available commands.
cli.invalidArguments: Invalid arguments for command '{command}'. Type 'help {command}' for usage.
cli.helpFooter: Type 'help <command>' to get more information about a specific command.
cli.help.task:
Manages tasks within SRA-cli.
Usage:
  task run [<name | path>...]
                Runs all selected tasks in specified configuration file(s).
                If no configuration file is specified, all config files in cache will be used.
  task single (taks_name | task_index) [<config_name | config_path>]
                Runs a single task specified by its name or index, wether it is selected or not.
                If no configuration file is specified, the current config file in cache will be used.
  task stop     Stops all running tasks.
cli.help.trigger:
Manages triggers within SRA-cli.
Usage:
  trigger run                   Starts the trigger service.
  trigger stop                  Stops the trigger service.
  trigger enable <trigger_name>    Enables a specific trigger.
  trigger disable <trigger_name>   Disables a specific trigger.
  trigger set-<type> <trigger_name> <property> <value>
                                Changes a property of a specific trigger.
cli.help.run:
Usage: run [<config_name | config_path>...]
Runs all tasks in specified configuration file(s). If no configuration file is specified, the current config file in cache will be used.
This command will block the CLI until all tasks are finished.
cli.help.single:
Usage: single (task_name | task_index) [<config_name | config_path>]
Runs a single task specified by its name or index, whether it is selected or not. If no configuration file is specified, the current config file in cache will be used.
This command will block the CLI until the task is finished.
cli.help.host: Start WebSocket server on specified port
cli.help.version: Displays the current version of SRA-cli.
cli.help.notify: Notification command - support test email notification
cli.exit.taskTimeout: Timeout reached while waiting for tasks to stop. Forcing exit.
cli.exit.triggerTimeout: Timeout reached while waiting for triggers to stop. Forcing exit.
cli.task.help: Manages tasks within SRA-cli, type 'help task' for more information.
cli.task.timeout: Timeout reached while waiting for tasks to complete.
cli.task.stopped: All running tasks have been stopped.
cli.trigger.help: Manages triggers within SRA-cli, type 'help trigger' for more information.
cli.trigger.timeout: Timeout reached while waiting for triggers to complete.
cli.trigger.attrSet: Attribute '{attr}' of trigger '{trigger_name}' has been set to '{value}'.
cli.run.help: Runs all selected tasks in specified configuration file, type 'help run' for more information.
cli.run.started: Task execution started, the CLI will be blocked until all tasks are finished.
cli.single.help: Runs a single task specified by its name or index, type 'help single' for more information.
cli.notify.help: Manages notifications within SRA-cli, type 'help notify' for more information.
cli.version.help: Displays the current version of SRA-cli.
cli.host.help:
Starts a WebSocket server on the specified port for remote control.

Usage:
  host <port>  Starts a WebSocket server on the specified port.
  host stop    Stops the WebSocket server.
argparse.description: SRA-cli: A command-line interface for SRA.
argparse.port_help: Port number to start the WebSocket server on.
argparse.version_help: Show the version of SRA-cli and exit.
argparse.run_help: Run all selected tasks in specified configuration file(s). Type 'run --help' for more information.
argparse.run_description:
Runs all tasks in specified configuration file(s).
If no configuration file is specified, the current config file in cache will be used.
This command will block the CLI until all tasks are finished.
argparse.single_help: Run a single task specified by its name or index. Type 'single --help' for more information.
argparse.single_description:
Runs a single task specified by its name or index, whether it is selected or not.
If no configuration file is specified, the current config file in cache will be used.
This command will block the CLI until the task is finished.
argparse.task_name_help: Name or index of the task to run.
argparse.once_help: Exit SRA-cli after running the command.
task.noSelectedTasks: No tasks are selected in {config_name}, skipping execution.
task.taskCrashed: Task '{name}' crashed due to an unexpected error: {error}
task.configCompleted: All tasks in config '{config_name}' have been completed.
task.managerCrashed: Task manager crashed due to an unexpected error: {error}
config.exception: An error occurred while loading config file '{path}': {error}
